body.header: Complete the sentences by filling each gap with the correct word or phrase.

ol.li: You've used the wrong here. If the man was in the wall, we wouldn't be able to see him!
You need to work on your pronunciation of English sounds, especially like 'b', as in the word 'big', and 'p', as in the word 'pig'.
The 'beautiful' has three syllables so the comparative is formed with 'more'.
There must be at least six different definitions of the , 'make up'. It's probably used most to mean 'invent', as in 'invent a story or excuse'.
Remember that the normal position of of frequency like 'never', 'sometimes', 'usually' and 'always' is after auxiliary verbs but before main verbs.
Try to vary the you use. You've used 'and' eight times when you could have used words or phrases like 'despite this' for contrast and 'in addition' for addition.
The word 'object' is both a verb and a . You can tell which part of speech it is by the way it's stressed.
You've made quite a few careless mistakes. Remember 'i' comes before 'e' except after 'c'.
It isn't clear who the 'him' refers to in this sentence - the dog or the man?
In order to expand your , you need to read more books and magazines and watch films.
You need to focus on individual sounds like 'a' in 'cat' and 'e' in 'egg'.
I often look words up in the dictionary but sometimes the are too difficult for me to understand!
Your tend to be too long. Some of them go on for three lines!
Your of English sounds is quite good but you do need to work on your intonation and stress too.
A lot of your are in the wrong tense. Have a look at the uses of the present simple and present continuous again.
